noun.description: The action of looking forward mentally; anticipation; consideration of the future; foresight, planning; an instance of this.
The action of prospecting (originally for mineral deposits, especially gold); an exploratory search, survey, etc.

origin: Late Middle English (in an earlier sense). From post-classical Latin prospection-, prospectio foresight, consideration of the future (301) from classical Latin prōspect-, past participial stem of prōspicere to look forward + -iō.
